metadata.Title: CVE-2022-37434 on Ubuntu 18.04 ESM (bionic) - medium
metadata.Description:
zlib through 1.2.12 has a heap-based buffer over-read or buffer overflow ininflate in inflate.c via a large gzip header extra field. NOTE: onlyapplications that call inflateGetHeader are affected. Some commonapplications bundle the affected zlib source code but may be unable to callinflateGetHeader (e.g., see the nodejs/node reference).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2022-37434` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

lib32z1 - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-0ubuntu2.2
lib64z1 - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-0ubuntu2.2
libx32z1 - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-0ubuntu2.2
zlib1g - 1:1.2.11.dfsg-0ubuntu2.2
No subscription required

rsync - 3.1.2-2.1ubuntu1.5
No subscription required

criterions.comment: zlib package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:1.2.11.dfsg-0ubuntu2.2').
rsync package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '3.1.2-2.1ubuntu1.5').
